title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing to osfr
text: outlines propose change osfr.

title: Contributing to osfr
text: get started osfr development ’ll need generate personal access token (PAT) OSF’s testing server. following steps get setup: Create account https://test.osf.io/. Generate PAT new account permission scopes enabled (necessary run osfr’s unit tests). (“Settings”->Personal access token) Fork osfr repository clone local copy. Create .Renviron file root project directory defines OSF_PAT OSF_SERVER environment variables. can easily create edit existing .Renviron file running usethis::edit_r_environ(scope = "project"). end result look like : Restart R load .Renviron file use readRneviron(".Renviron"). load local copy osfr devtools::load_all() verify osf_open(osf_retrieve_user("")) opens user profile test.osf.io domain. setup correctly, able run osfr’s tests without error (devtools::test()). can also enable logging defining OSF_LOG point logfile. example: log API requests osfr.log inspection.
code: OSF_PAT=<YOUR PAT GOES HERE> OSF_SERVER=test OSF_PAT=osfr.log

title: Contributing to osfr
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. : edit .Rd file man/.

title: Contributing to osfr
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: Contributing to osfr
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look Travis AppVeyor build status making changes. README contain badges continuous integration services used package. New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: Contributing to osfr
text: Run make docs : * rebuild README.md README.Rmd * regenerate precomputed vignette getting_started.Rmd getting_started.Rmd.orig * rebuild vignettes * rebuild package documentation Run make * perform documentation steps noted * build package * check package CRAN without running tests (temporary mock tests implemented) Helpers: make clean remove build/check files make test run unit tests make check run R CMD check package make revdep run reverse dependency checks make tag tag last git commit current version

title: Authenticating osfr
text: vignette covers obtain use OSF personal access token (PAT) use osfr. PATs required upload files, create projects/components, access information private projects, download files private projects. PATs required accessing information public projects downloading public files, authentication PAT increase rate limit API. Unauthenticated requests limited 100 per hour; Authenticated requests limited 10,000 per day. , planning make large number calls API, suggest authenticating PAT even one required functions running.

title: Authenticating osfr
text: create OSF PAT, log OSF browser, navigate OSF settings page, click create token button. need create PAT least osf.read_full scope; want able edit information package, also need PAT osf.write_full permissions. PAT created, save safe space.

title: Authenticating osfr
text: can authenticate two different ways: Call osf_auth() function console start new session paste PAT. PAT functions like password, hard coded scripts, ever. authenticate automatically, store PAT environment variable named OSF_PAT, osfr detect upon loaded. One way create .Renviron file home project working directory defines OSF_PAT. ’d like learn .Renviron files, R Startup chapter Forgot Teach R highly recommended.
code: osf_auth("ThIsIsNoTaReAlPaTbUtYoUgEtIt")

title: Authenticating osfr
text: PAT accidentally publicly released world, deactivate PAT. , navigate OSF settings page click :x: right PAT want deactivate. can create new PAT reauthenticate.

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: OSF free open source web application provides space researchers collaboratively store, manage, share research materials (e.g. data, code, protocols). work OSF organized around projects, include cloud-based storage bucket files can stored organized directories. Note storage limit size projects individual files must < 5Gb. Projects can kept private, shared specific group collaborators, made publicly available citable DOIs can get credit work. ’d like learn OSF Center Open Science published excellent series guides help get started. ’ll provide links specific guides throughout vignette. relevant topics: Creating projects components Managing projects Collaborating projects

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Let’s check example project containing materials analysis 2012 American National Election Survey (ANES). can access OSF project browser navigating URL: https://osf.io/jgyxm/. Let’s load project R osfr::osf_retrieve_node(): returns osf_tbl object, data.frame-like class osfr uses represent items retrieved OSF. can now use anes_project perform variety project related tasks passing different osfr functions.
code: anes_project <- osf_retrieve_node("https://osf.io/jgyxm") anes_project #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   name                                id    meta             #>   <chr>                               <chr> <list>           #> 1 Political identification and gender jgyxm <named list [3]>

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Let’s list files uploaded project: returns another osf_tbl one contains 5 rows; one project files stored OSF. nice feature OSF provides rendered views wide variety file formats, ’s necessary actually download open file just want quickly examine . Let’s open Word Document containing project’s data dictionary extracting relevant row anes_tbl passing osf_open(): osf_tbls just specialized data.frames, also subset() dplyr::filter() achieve result. Note: osf_tbl multiple entities passed non-vectorized osfr function like osf_open(), default behavior use entity first row warn entities ignored. can also download local copies files passing anes_files osf_download(). ’ll use files next section creating new project.
code: anes_files <- osf_ls_files(anes_project) anes_files #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   name                 id                       meta             #>   <chr>                <chr>                    <list>           #> 1 cleaning.R           5e20d22bedceab002d82e0f1 <named list [3]> #> 2 Questionnaire.docx   5e20d22bedceab002b82dc3f <named list [3]> #> 3 raw_data.csv         5e20d22c675e0e00096b4de8 <named list [3]> #> 4 Data Dictionary.docx 5e20d22c675e0e000e6b4b18 <named list [3]> #> 5 analyses.R           5e20d22c675e0e000a6b4bd3 <named list [3]> osf_open(anes_files[4, ]) osf_download(anes_files) #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   name                 id                       local_path          meta         #>   <chr>                <chr>                    <chr>               <list>       #> 1 cleaning.R           5e20d22bedceab002d82e0f1 ./cleaning.R        <named list> #> 2 Questionnaire.docx   5e20d22bedceab002b82dc3f ./Questionnaire.do… <named list> #> 3 raw_data.csv         5e20d22c675e0e00096b4de8 ./raw_data.csv      <named list> #> 4 Data Dictionary.docx 5e20d22c675e0e000e6b4b18 ./Data Dictionary.… <named list> #> 5 analyses.R           5e20d22c675e0e000a6b4bd3 ./analyses.R        <named list>

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: ’ve likely noticed, osf_tbl objects central osfr’s functionality. Indeed, nearly functions expect osf_tbl input return osf_tbl output. , osfr functions can chained together using pipe operator (%>%), allowing creation pipelines automate OSF-based tasks. short example consolidates steps ’ve performed far:
code: osf_retrieve_node("jgyxm") %>%   osf_ls_files() %>%   osf_download()

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Now let’s see use osfr create manage projects. goal section create version Political Identification Gender project better organizational structure. follow along section ’ll need authenticate osfr using personal access token (PAT). See ?osf_auth() function documentation auth vignette information.

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: First need create new private project OSF store files related project. , ’re giving new project title (required) description (optional). GUID new project f7bgz, something different. can check project OSF opening ’s URL (https://www.osf.io/<GUID>), , conveniently: osf_open(my_project).
code: my_project <- osf_create_project(   title = "Political Identification and Gender: Re-examined",   description = "A re-analysis of the original study's results." ) my_project #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   name                                             id    meta             #>   <chr>                                            <chr> <list>           #> 1 Political Identification and Gender: Re-examined f7bgz <named list [3]>

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: key organizational feature OSF ability augment project’s structure sub-projects, referred components OSF. Like top-level projects, every component assigned unique URL contains cloud-based storage bucket. can also different privacy settings parent project. going create two nested components, one raw data one analysis scripts. refresh OSF project browser Components widget now contain two entries newly created components.
code: data_comp <- osf_create_component(my_project, title = "Raw Data") script_comp <- osf_create_component(my_project, title = "Analysis Scripts")  # verify the components were created # osf_open(my_project)

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Now project components place can start populate files. Let’s start csv file containing raw data. Oh ! Instead uploading raw_data.csv Raw Data component, uploaded parent project instead. Fear . can easily fix contrived mistake simply moving file intended location. Crisis averted. Now open Raw Data OSF (osf_open(data_comp)), contain csv file. next step upload R scripts Analysis Scripts component. Rather upload file individually, ’ll take advantage osf_upload()’s ability handle multiple files/directories use list.files() identify .R files working directory:
code: data_file  <- osf_upload(my_project, path = "raw_data.csv") data_file #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   name         id                       meta             #>   <chr>        <chr>                    <list>           #> 1 raw_data.csv 63309f3e18f4581162429679 <named list [3]> data_file <- osf_mv(data_file, to = data_comp) r_files <- osf_upload(script_comp, path = list.files(pattern = ".R$")) r_files #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   name         id                       meta             #>   <chr>        <chr>                    <list>           #> 1 analyses.R   63309f47408a27127e7637de <named list [3]> #> 2 cleaning.R   63309f4a555fe211977a9017 <named list [3]> #> 3 precompile.R 63309f4c18f4581167428d70 <named list [3]>

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Finally, let’s repeat process 2 .docx file containing survey accompanying data dictionary. time ’ll use succinct approach leverages pipes create populate component one block: can verify project now structured way wanted listing components main project. gives us osf_tbl one row project’s components.
code: my_project %>%   osf_create_component("Research Materials") %>%   osf_upload(path = list.files(pattern = "\\.docx$")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   name                 id                       meta             #>   <chr>                <chr>                    <list>           #> 1 Data Dictionary.docx 63309f526c2401128550a2bc <named list [3]> #> 2 Questionnaire.docx   63309f5418f4581150428ef4 <named list [3]> osf_ls_nodes(my_project) #> # A tibble: 3 × 3 #>   name               id    meta             #>   <chr>              <chr> <list>           #> 1 Research Materials dg79a <named list [3]> #> 2 Analysis Scripts   fquzh <named list [3]> #> 3 Raw Data           6urqv <named list [3]>

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: OSF provides automatic unlimited file versioning. Let’s see works osfr. Make small edit local copy cleaning.R save. Now, attempt upload new version Analysis Scripts component, osfr throw conflict error: error indicates, need use conflicts argument instruct osf_upload() handle conflict. case, want overwrite original copy new version: Learn file versioning OSF .
code: osf_upload(script_comp, path = "cleaning.R") Error: Can't upload file 'cleaning.R'.   * A file with the same name already exists at the destination.   * Use the `conflicts` argument to avoid this error in the future. osf_upload(script_comp, path = "cleaning.R", conflicts = "overwrite")

title: Getting Started with osfr
text: Remember, new OSF projects always private default. can change opening project’s settings page OSF making public. See following guides information OSF permissions optionally generate DOI can cite project. Control privacy settings Sharing, linking, forking projects Generate DOIs

what: A few details about files on OSF
title: Getting Started with osfr
text: OSF, files can exist projects, components, /directories. Files can stored OSF’s Storage another service connected OSF project (e.g. GitHub, Dropbox, Google Drive). However, osfr currently supports interacting files OSF Storage. can download files public private node access can identify files download two different ways: know file located, don’t remember GUID, can use osf_ls_files function filter filename within specified node pipe results osf_download(). public file referenced published article, may already GUID, can retrieve file directly downloading . example, let’s download Daniel Laken’s helpful spreadsheet calculating effect sizes (available https://osf.io/vbdah/).
code: anes_project %>%   osf_ls_files(pattern = ) %>%   osf_download(conflicts = "overwrite") osf_retrieve_file("vbdah") %>%   osf_download(excel_file)

Soderberg and Timothy P. York},   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},   year = {2020},   volume = {5},   number = {46},   pages = {2071},   url = {https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.02071},   doi = {10.21105/joss.02071}, }

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: osfr provides suite functions interacting Open Science Framework (OSF). OSF? OSF free open source project management repository designed support researchers across entire project lifecycle. service includes unlimited cloud storage file version history, providing centralized location research materials can kept private, shared select collaborators, made publicly available citable DOIs.

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: can install current release osfr CRAN (recommended): development version GitHub remotes package:
code: install.packages("osfr") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ropensci/osfr")

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: Note: need setup OSF personal access token (PAT) use osfr manage projects upload files.

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: Many researchers use OSF archive share work. can use osfr explore publicly accessible projects download associated files—need get started project’s URL GUID (global unique identifier). Every user, project, component, file OSF assigned GUID embedded corresponding entity’s URL. example, can access main OSF project Cancer Reproducibility Project https://osf.io/e81xl/. GUID project e81xl. can use osfr retrieve project load R providing GUID: returns osf_tbl object single row representing retrieved project. Let’s list files uploaded project. returns another osf_tbl 1 row files directories project. can examine files directly OSF osf_open(), opens corresponding file’s view default browser. project contains 2 components: Replication Studies Data collection publishing guidelines. can list components osfr using osf_ls_nodes(). osfr compatible pipe operator dplyr, providing powerful set tools working osf_tbls. , ’re listing sub-components nested within Replication Studies component, filtering specific study (Study 19) listing files uploaded study’s component. continue pattern exploration even download local copies project files using osf_download(). , come across publication directly references file’s OSF URL, quickly download project directory providing URL simply GUID:
code: library(osfr)  cr_project <- osf_retrieve_node("e81xl") cr_project #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   name                                    id    meta             #>   <chr>                                   <chr> <list>           #> 1 Reproducibility Project: Cancer Biology e81xl <named list [3]> osf_ls_files(cr_project) #> # A tibble: 4 × 3 #>   name                                        id                    meta         #>   <chr>                                       <chr>                 <list>       #> 1 papers_and_keywords.xlsx                    553e671b8c5e4a219919… <named list> #> 2 Full_dataset_of_papers_formatted.xls        553e671b8c5e4a219919… <named list> #> 3 METHOD_to_select_papers.txt                 553e671b8c5e4a219919… <named list> #> 4 Adjustment of 50 studies to 37 studies.docx 565602398c5e4a3877d7… <named list> osf_ls_nodes(cr_project) #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #>   name                                                        id    meta         #>   <chr>                                                       <chr> <list>       #> 1 Meta-analysis paper figures and tables                      squy7 <named list> #> 2 Replication Data from the Reproducibility Project: Cancer … e5nvr <named list> #> 3 Process paper figures and reported statistics               35ut8 <named list> #> 4 Replication Studies                                         p7ayb <named list> #> 5 Data collection and publishing guidelines                   a5imq <named list> library(dplyr)  cr_project %>%   osf_ls_nodes() %>%   filter(name == "Replication Studies") %>%   osf_ls_nodes(pattern = "Study 19") %>%   osf_ls_files() #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   name                                      id                      meta         #>   <chr>                                     <chr>                   <list>       #> 1 Replication_Study_19.Rmd                  578e2b23594d9001f48164… <named list> #> 2 Study_19_Correction_Letter.docx           5a56569125719b000ff28b… <named list> #> 3 Replication_Study_19.docx                 57c9e8ed594d9001e7a240… <named list> #> 4 Response_letter_Replication_Study_19.docx 58755747b83f6901ff066a… <named list> #> 5 Replication_Study_19_track_changes.docx   581a27b76c613b02233228… <named list> #> 6 Replication_Study_19_track_changes_2.docx 58714d46594d9001f801f4… <named list> osf_retrieve_file("https://osf.io/btgx3/") %>%   osf_download() #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   name                  id    local_path              meta             #>   <chr>                 <chr> <chr>                   <list>           #> 1 Study_19_Figure_1.pdf btgx3 ./Study_19_Figure_1.pdf <named list [3]>

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: can use osfr create projects, add sub-components directories, upload files. See Getting Started learn building projects osfr, quick example : Create new project called Motor Trend Car Road Tests Create sub-component called Car Data Create directory named rawdata Upload file (mtcars.csv) new directory Open uploaded file OSF Screenshot uploaded file OSF
code: # create an external data file write.csv(mtcars, "mtcars.csv")  osf_create_project(title = "Motor Trend Car Road Tests") %>%   osf_create_component("Car Data") %>%   osf_mkdir("rawdata") %>%   osf_upload("mtcars.csv") %>%   osf_open()

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: 3 main types OSF entities osfr can work : nodes: projects components (.e., sub-projects) referred nodes files: includes files folders stored OSF users: individuals OSF accounts osfr represents entities within osf_tbls—specialized data frames built tibble class provide useful information entities like name unique id users, API data meta column ’s necessary osfr’s internal functions. Otherwise, ’re just data.frames can manipulated using standard functions base R dplyr.

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: OSF developed Center Open Science Charlottesville, VA. original version osfr developed Chris Chartgerink developed Brian Richards Ryan Hafen. current version developed Aaron Wolen heavily inspired Jennifer Bryan Lucy D’Agostino McGowan’s excellent googledrive package. Seriously, borrowed lot great ideas . important resources include http testing Scott Chamberlain R Packages Hadley Wickham. Development also greatly facilitated OSF’s excellent API documentation. Big thanks Rusty Speidel designing logo Tim Errington feedback development.

title: Interface to the Open Science Framework (OSF)
text: Check Contributing Guidelines get started osfr development note contributing project, agree abide terms outlined Contributor Code Conduct.

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
text: Extract OSF GUIDs Waterbutler IDs various types inputs. Valid looking IDs returned osf_id objects.

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
code: as_id(x)

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
text: x osf_tbl, OSF URL, generic string containing GUID Waterbutler ID.

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
text: character vector class osf_id.

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
text: 2 types identifiers encounter OSF. first globally unique identifier, GUID, OSF assigns every entity. valid OSF GUID consists 5 alphanumeric characters. second type identifier specific files stored OSF. file operations OSF handled via Waterbutler. valid Waterbutler ID consists 24 alphanumeric characters.

title: Extract OSF identifiers — as_id
code: if (FALSE) { # extract a GUID from an OSF URL proj_id <- as_id("https://osf.io/7zqxp/")  # extract waterbutler IDs from an `osf_tbl_file`` with multiple files osf_retrieve_node(proj_id) %>%   osf_ls_files() %>%   as_id() }

what: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: Authorize osfr interact OSF data OSF account passing personal access token (PAT) osf_auth(). token provided, osf_auth() attempt obtain PAT OSF_PAT environment variable. However, since osfr checks presence OSF_PAT start-, necessary variable created redefined middle session. See additional details instructions generating utilizing PAT.

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
code: osf_auth(token = NULL)

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: token OSF personal access token.

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: Invisibly returns OSF PAT along message indicating registered.

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: box osfr can access publicly available projects, components, files OSF. order osfr view manage private resources must provide Personal Access Token (PAT). following instructions walk process generating PAT using authenticate osfr.

what: Creating an OSF personal access token
title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: Navigate https://osf.io/settings/tokens/ Click New token button provide descriptive name Select scopes (.e., permissions) like grant osfr Click Create button generate PAT successful, 70 character token displayed along several important warnings definitely read carefully read warnings, right? Copy token keep safe place

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: two possible approaches authenticating osfr PAT. simpler approach call osf_auth() function start every new R session manually paste token. Note PAT treated like password , , hardcoded script. better approach store PAT environment variable called OSF_PAT. allow osfr detect utilize token automatically without need manually call osf_auth(). One way accomplish creating .Renviron file home working directory defines OSF_PAT variable. example:   new users suggest adding .Renviron home directory automatically applied projects. verify done correctly, restart R run Sys.getenv("OSF_PAT"), return PAT.
code: OSF_PAT=bdEEFMCuBtaBoSK11YzyjOdjUjKtWIj2FWxHl6kTBRax7uaeyBghALumTO1kT8RA

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
text: Colin Gillespie Robin Lovelace (2017). Efficient R programming. O'Reilly Press. https://csgillespie.github.io/efficientR/.

title: Authenticate osfr with a personal access token — osf_auth
code: if (FALSE) { # manually authenticate with a PAT osf_auth("bdEEFMCuBtaBoSK11YzyjOdjUjKtWIj2FWxHl6kTBRax7uaeyBghALumTO1kT8RA") }

what: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
text: Use osf_cp() make copy file directory new location.

title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
code: osf_cp(x, to, overwrite = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
text: x osf_tbl_file containing single file directory. Destination file directory copied. can one following: osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_file single directory. overwrite Logical, file directory name already exists destination replaced x? verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
text: osf_tbl_file containing updated OSF file.

title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
text: Note file (directory) moved copied onto , even overwrite = TRUE.

title: Copy a file or directory — osf_cp
code: if (FALSE) { project <- osf_create_project("Flower Data")  write.csv(iris, file = "iris.csv") data_file <- osf_upload(project,"iris.csv")  # Create a new directory to copy our file to data_dir <- osf_mkdir(project, "data")  # Copy the file to our data directory data_file <- osf_cp(data_file, to = data_dir)  # Copy directory to new component data_comp <- osf_create_component(project, title = "data", category = "data") data_dir %>%   osf_cp(to = data_comp) %>%   osf_open() }

what: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
text: Use osf_create_project() create new top-level project OSF. nested component can created providing osf_tbl_node containing existing project component osf_create_component()'s x argument.

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
code: osf_create_project(   title,   description = NULL,   public = FALSE,   category = "project" )  osf_create_component(   x,   title,   description = NULL,   public = FALSE,   category = NULL )

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
text: title, description Set title (required) , optionally, description. public Logical, publicly available (TRUE) private (FALSE, default)? category Character string, specify category change icon displayed OSF. defaults "project" projects "uncategorized" components. specified category can easily changed later OSF. Valid category options include: analysis communication data hypothesis instrumentation methods measures procedure project software x osf_tbl_node single OSF project component serve new sub-component's parent node.

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
text: osf_tbl_node containing new project component.

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
text: Projects components implemented nodes OSF. distinction two project top-level node, component must parent node (.e., must sub-component another project component). projects components functionally identical, osfr uses osf_tbl_node class represent .

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
text: OSF Guides: Create Project. https://help.osf.io/article/383-creating--project. OSF Guides: Create Component. https://help.osf.io/article/253-create-components.

title: Create a new project or component on OSF — osf_create
code: if (FALSE) { # create a new public project project <- osf_create_project(title = "Private OSF Project", public = TRUE)  # add a private component to the new project component <- osf_create_component(project, title = "Project Data") }

what: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
text: Files stored OSF can downloaded locally passing osf_tbl_file contains files folders interest. Use path specify files downloaded, otherwise downloaded working directory default.

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
code: osf_download(   x,   path = NULL,   recurse = FALSE,   conflicts = "error",   verbose = FALSE,   progress = FALSE )

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
text: x osf_tbl_file containing single file directory. path Path pointing local directory downloaded files saved. Default use current working directory. recurse Applies OSF directories. TRUE, directory fully recursed nested files subdirectories downloaded. Alternatively, positive number determine number levels recurse. conflicts determines happens file name exists specified destination. Can one following: "error" (default): throw error abort file transfer operation. "skip": skip conflicting file(s) continue transferring remaining files. "overwrite": replace existing file transferred copy. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE). progress Logical, TRUE progress bars displayed file transfer. Mainly useful transferring large files. tracking lots small files, setting verbose = TRUE informative.

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
text: osf_tbl_file passed x new column, "local_path", containing paths local files.

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
text: Directories always downloaded OSF zip files contain entire contents. logic handling conflicts recursion implemented locally, acting files temporary location copying path needed. creates gotcha downloading directories large files assuming setting conflicts = "skip" /limiting recursion reduce number files downloading. case, better strategy use osf_ls_files() list contents directory pass output osf_download().

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
text: osf_download() osf_upload() allow conveniently shuttle files back forth OSF local machine, important note file synchronization functions. contrast something like rsync, osf_download()/osf_upload() take account file's contents modification time. Whether uploading downloading, conflicts = "overwrite", osfr overwrite existing file regardless whether recent copy. warned.

title: Download files and directories from OSF — osf_download
code: if (FALSE) { # download a single file analysis_plan <- osf_retrieve_file("2ryha") %>%   osf_download()  # verify the file was downloaded locally file.exists(analysis_plan$local_path) }

what: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
title: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
text: List files directories top-level OSF project, component, directory. Specify path list contents particular subdirectory.

title: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
code: osf_ls_files(   x,   path = NULL,   type = "any",   pattern = NULL,   n_max = 10,   verbose = FALSE )

title: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
text: x One following: osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_file single directory. path List files within specified subdirectory path. type Filter query type. Set "file" list files, "folder"list folders pattern Character string used filter results contain substring "pattern" name. Note: fixed, case-insensitive search. n_max Maximum number results return OSF (default 10). Set Inf return results. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
text: osf_tbl_file one row file directory, ordered modification time.

title: List files and directories on OSF — osf_ls_files
code: if (FALSE) { # Retrieve the Psychology Reproducibility Project from OSF psych_rp <- osf_retrieve_node("ezum7")  # List all files and directories osf_ls_files(psych_rp)  # ...only the directories osf_ls_files(psych_rp, type = "folder")  # ...only PDF files osf_ls_files(psych_rp, type = "file", pattern = "pdf")  # List the contents of the first directory osf_ls_files(psych_rp, path = "RPP_SI_Figures") }

what: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
title: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
text: List projects components associated user contained top-level another OSF project component.

title: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
code: osf_ls_nodes(x, pattern = NULL, n_max = 10, verbose = FALSE)

title: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
text: x one following: osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_user single OSF user. pattern Character string used filter results contain substring "pattern" name. Note: fixed, case-insensitive search. n_max Maximum number results return OSF (default 10). Set Inf return results. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
text: osf_tbl_node one row OSF project component, ordered modification time.

title: List projects or components on OSF — osf_ls_nodes
code: if (FALSE) { # List your recent projects and components osf_retrieve_user("me") %>%   osf_ls_nodes()  # List the first 10 components in the #ScanAllFish project fish_ctscans <- osf_retrieve_node("ecmz4") osf_ls_nodes(fish_ctscans)  # Now just the components with scans of species from the Sphyrna genus osf_ls_nodes(fish_ctscans, pattern = "Sphyrna") }

title: Create directories on OSF — osf_mkdir
text: Use osf_mkdir() add new directories projects, components, nested within existing OSF directories. path contains multiple directory levels (e.g., "data/rawdata") intermediate-level directories created automatically. directory attempting create already exists OSF silently ignored included output.

title: Create directories on OSF — osf_mkdir
code: osf_mkdir(x, path, verbose = FALSE)

title: Create directories on OSF — osf_mkdir
text: x One following: osf_tbl_node single OSF project component. osf_tbl_file containing single directory. path Name new directory path ending new directory. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: Create directories on OSF — osf_mkdir
text: osf_tbl_file one row containing leaf directory specified path.

title: Create directories on OSF — osf_mkdir
code: if (FALSE) { proj <- osf_create_project("Directory Example")  # add directory to the top-level of the Directory Example project data_dir <- osf_mkdir(proj, path = "data")  # add a subdirectory nested within data/ osf_mkdir(data_dir, path = "rawdata")  # recursively create multiple directory levels within data/ osf_mkdir(data_dir, path = "samples/pcr/qc") }

what: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
text: Use osf_mv() move file directory new project, component, subdirectory.

title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
code: osf_mv(x, to, overwrite = FALSE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
text: x osf_tbl_file containing single file directory. Destination file directory moved. can one following: osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_file single directory. overwrite Logical, file directory name already exists destination replaced x? verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
text: osf_tbl_file containing updated OSF file.

title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
text: Note file (directory) moved copied onto , even overwrite = TRUE.

title: Move a file or directory — osf_mv
code: if (FALSE) { # Create an example file to upload to our example project project <- osf_create_project("Flower Data")  write.csv(iris, file = "iris.csv") data_file <- osf_upload(project,"iris.csv")  # Create a new directory to move our file to data_dir <- osf_mkdir(project, "data")  # Move the file to our data directory data_file <- osf_mv(data_file, to = data_dir)  # Move our data directory to a new component data_comp <- osf_create_component(project, title = "data", category = "data") data_dir %>%   osf_mv(to = data_comp) %>%   osf_open() }

title: Open on OSF — osf_open
text: View project, component, file, user profile OSF default web browser.

title: Open on OSF — osf_open
code: osf_open(x)

title: Open on OSF — osf_open
text: x one following: OSF URL, generic string containing GUID Waterbutler ID. osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_file single file directory. osf_tbl_user single OSF user.

title: Open on OSF — osf_open
code: if (FALSE) { # Navigate to a project based on its GUID osf_open("e81xl")  # You can also provide an osf_tbl subclass crp_file <- osf_retrieve_file("ucpye") osf_open(crp_file) }

title: Refresh an OSF entity — osf_refresh
text: Use osf_refresh() update one entities osf_tbl() latest information OSF.

title: Refresh an OSF entity — osf_refresh
code: osf_refresh(x)

title: Refresh an OSF entity — osf_refresh
text: x osf_tbl.

what: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: Create osf_tbl representation existing OSF project, component, file, user based associated unique identifier. Usually 5-character global unique identifier (GUID) files directories, also 11-character Waterbutler ID. See details.

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
code: osf_retrieve_user(id)  osf_retrieve_node(id)  osf_retrieve_file(id)

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: id OSF identifier corresponding OSF user, project, component, file. Set id = "" retrieve OSF profile.

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: osf_tbl_user, osf_tbl_node, osf_tbl_file containing corresponding OSF entity.

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: 5-character GUID assigned every user, project, component, file OSF forms basis service's URL scheme. example GUID project accessible https://osf.io/ezum7 simply ezum7. can learn GUIDs OSF FAQ. important detail files directories handled internally OSF another serviced called Waterbutler, uses 11-character identifiers. Although Waterbutler IDs largely hidden users https://osf.io, represent primary method identifying files/directories OSF API. fact, files receive GUID viewed directly https://osf.io directories never receive GUID. Therefore, osfr relies Waterbutler IDs files directories, always includes (rather GUIDs) osf_tbl_file objects.

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: begin using osfr interact resources OSF must use one following retrieve functions create osf_tbl contains entity interest. Note functions entity-type specific, use: osf_retrieve_node() retrieve project component osf_retrieve_file() retrieve file directory osf_retrieve_user() retrieve user

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
text: OSF supports integration variety 3rd-party cloud storage providers, osfr can currently access files stored default OSF storage service. Support additional storage providers planned future release.

title: Retrieve an entity from OSF — osf_retrieve
code: if (FALSE) {  # retrieve your own OSF user profile (must be authenticated, ?osf_auth)  osf_retrieve_user("me")  # retrieve the Psychology Reproducibility Project (P:RP, osf.io/ezum7) osf_retrieve_node("ezum7")  # get the first figure from the P:RP osf_retrieve_file("https://osf.io/7js8c") }

what: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
title: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
text: Use osf_rm() permanently delete project, component, file directory OSF, including uploaded files, wiki content, comments contained therein. process irreversible, osfr first open item web browser can verify deleted proceeding. project component targeted deletion contains sub-components, must deleted first. Setting recurse = TRUE attempt remove hierarchy sub-components deleting top-level entity. Note: functionality limited contributors admin-level permissions.

title: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
code: osf_rm(x, recurse = FALSE, verbose = FALSE, check = TRUE)

title: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
text: x One following: osf_tbl_node single OSF project component. osf_tbl_file containing single directory file. recurse Remove sub-components deleting top-level entity. applies deleting projects components. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE). check FALSE deletion proceed without opening item requesting verification---effectively removes safety net.

title: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
text: Invisibly returns TRUE deletion successful.

title: Delete an entity from OSF — osf_rm
code: if (FALSE) { project <- osf_create_project("My Short-Lived Project") osf_rm(project) }

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: Items retrieved OSF represented osf_tbl objects, specialized data frames based tibble class. See additional details.

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: row osf_tbl represents single OSF entity. user, project, component, directory, file. osf_tbl must include following 3 columns: name: indicates name title entity. id: unique identifier assigned OSF. meta: list-column stores processed response returned OSF's API. See Meta column section information.

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: osf_tbl parent class 3 subclasses used represent OSF's main entities: osf_tbl_user users. osf_tbl_file files directories. osf_tbl_node projects components.

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: Projects components implemented nodes OSF. distinction two project top-level node, component must parent node (.e., must sub-component another project component). projects components functionally identical, osfr uses osf_tbl_node class represent .

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: meta column contains information returned OSF's API single entity, structured named list 3 elements: attributes contains metadata entity (e.g., names, descriptions, tags, etc). links contains urls API endpoints alternative representations entity actions may performed entity. relationships contains URLs entities relationships entity (e.g., collaborators attached project). information critical osfr's internal functions altered users. even information elements, see OSF's API documentation.

title: OSF Tibbles — osf_tbl
text: implementation osf_tbl class based dribble objects googledrive package.

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: Upload local files project, component, directory OSF.

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
code: osf_upload(   x,   path,   recurse = FALSE,   conflicts = "error",   progress = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: x upload destination OSF. Can one following: osf_tbl_node single project component. osf_tbl_file single directory. path character vector paths pointing existing local files /directories. recurse TRUE, fully recurse directories included path. can also control number levels recurse specifying positive number. conflicts determines happens file name exists specified destination. Can one following: "error" (default): throw error abort file transfer operation. "skip": skip conflicting file(s) continue transferring remaining files. "overwrite": replace existing file transferred copy. progress Logical, TRUE progress bars displayed file transfer. Mainly useful transferring large files. tracking lots small files, setting verbose = TRUE informative. verbose Logical, indicating whether print informative messages interactions OSF API (default FALSE).

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: osf_tbl_file containing uploaded files directories directly specified path.

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: x argument indicates OSF files uploaded (.e., destination). path argument indicates uploaded, can include combination files directories. path points local file, file uploaded root specified OSF destination, regardless local machine (.e., intermediate paths preserved). example, following upload .txt b.txt root my_proj:   path points local directory, corresponding directory created root OSF destination, x, files within local directory uploaded new OSF directory. Therefore, maintain directory structure example passing b.txt's parent directory path instead file :   Likewise, osf_upload(my_proj, path = ".") upload entire current working directory specified OSF destination.
code: osf_upload(my_proj, c("a.txt", "subdir/b.txt"))` osf_upload(my_proj, c("a.txt", "subdir2"))

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: order upload directly existing OSF directory first need retrieve directory osf_tbl_file. can accomplished passing directory's unique identifier osf_retrieve_file(), , ID handy, can use osf_ls_files() retrieve directory name.
code: # search for the 'rawdata' subdirectory within top-level 'data' directory target_dir <- osf_ls_files(my_proj, path = "data", pattern = "rawdata") # upload 'a.txt' to data/rawdata/ on OSF osf_upload(target_dir, path = "a.txt")

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
text: osf_download() osf_upload() allow conveniently shuttle files back forth OSF local machine, important note file synchronization functions. contrast something like rsync, osf_download()/osf_upload() take account file's contents modification time. Whether uploading downloading, conflicts = "overwrite", osfr overwrite existing file regardless whether recent copy. warned.

title: Upload files to OSF — osf_upload
code: if (FALSE) { # Create an example file to upload to our example project write.csv(iris, file = "iris.csv") project <- osf_create_project("Flower Data")  # Upload the first version osf_upload(project,"iris.csv")  # Modify the data file, upload version 2, and view it on OSF write.csv(subset(iris, Species != "setosa"), file = "iris.csv") project %>%   osf_upload("iris.csv", conflicts = "overwrite") %>%   osf_open() }

what: osfr: R interface to OSF — osfr-package
title: osfr: R interface to OSF — osfr-package
text: osfr provides suite functions interacting Open Science Framework (OSF; https://osf.io/).

title: osfr: R interface to OSF — osfr-package
text: OSF free open source project management repository designed support researchers across entire project lifecycle. service includes free cloud storage file version history, providing centralized location research materials can kept private, shared select collaborators, made publicly available citable DOIs. work OSF organized around projects. Projects can contain files, groups files directories, /files sub-projects called components. Note storage limit size projects individual files must < 5Gb.

title: osfr: R interface to OSF — osfr-package
text: learn OSF check helpful series guides published Center Open Science: https://help.osf.io See vignette overview osfr's features: vignette("getting_started", package = "osfr")

title: osfr: R interface to OSF — osfr-package
text: Maintainer: Aaron Wolen aaron@wolen.com (ORCID) Authors: Chris Hartgerink chjh@protonmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Timothy York timothypyork@gmail.com (ORCID) [contributor] Ryan Hafen rhafen@purdue.edu [contributor] Brian Richards brian.g.richards@gmail.com [contributor] Courtney Soderberg courtney@cos.io (ORCID) [contributor] Carl Boettiger cboettig@gmail.com (ORCID) [reviewer] Heidi Seibold heidi.seibold@stat.uni-muenchen.de [reviewer]

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: Pipe operator

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: osfr 0.2.9
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-25

title: osfr 0.2.9
text: tibble v3.0.0 now minimum required version

title: osfr 0.2.9
text: Fixed bug preventing uploads directly OSF directories contained conflicting files (#121, #129) Fixed pkgdown site build (#147) Fixed downloading files via GUIDs (#141, thanks @psanker)

title: osfr 0.2.9
text: Unit tests single file uploads, html encoding, basic node mechanics now mocked vcr (#145) GitHub Actions now used continuous integration (#146) brio now used tests writing text files \n used line endings Windows. produces files identical sizes platforms allowing vcr match requests include file sizes body (#146).

title: osfr 0.2.8
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-17 Initial CRAN release Publication accompanying paper Journal Open Source Software can cited papers using osfr, see citation("osfr") details

title: osfr 0.2.8
text: Add rOpenSci reviewers DESCRIPTION Remove deleted URLs vignette Add badges zenodo JOSS Add Makefile common developer tasks

title: osfr 0.2.7
text: osfr now part rOpenSci documentation website moved new URL: https://docs.ropensci.org/osfr/.

title: osfr 0.2.7
text: New osf_cp() function copying files new locations (@tpyork, #114)

title: osfr 0.2.7
text: getting started vignette overhauled better leverage multi-file transfers now precomputed Encoded HTML symbols node titles now handled properly (#117) osf_rm() argument recursive renamed recurse order consistent functions Internal links now point ropensci repository new documentation URL

title: osfr 0.2.6
text: New approach uses file manifest compare local remote files now search conflicting remote files within directory queued upload, avoids issue reported (#108, thanks @tpyork)

title: osfr 0.2.6
text: Fix pkgdown deployment

title: osfr 0.2.6
text: Fix project creation windows (#110) Fix tests PAT undefined

title: osfr 0.2.6
text: Add JOSS paper

title: osfr 0.2.5
text: osf_download() osf_upload() now vectorized, making process adding files retrieving files OSF much convenient. functionality required significant refactoring brings several notable breaking changes (see ).

title: osfr 0.2.5
text: osf_download() osf_upload() gain option display progress bars. New osf_refresh() update existing osf_tbl. Devs can now enable logging API requests responses definingOSF_LOG (see Contributing information).

title: osfr 0.2.5
text: osf_download() osf_upload()’s overwrite argument replaced conflicts, can set "error" (default), "skip", "overwrite". osf_upload()’s name argument removed, longer possible upload file change ’s OSF name. osf_download()’s path argument must point existing directory downloaded files saved. osf_download()’s decompress argument removed. zip file downloaded OSF always decompressed temp directory enclosed files selectively copied specified path.

title: osfr 0.2.5
text: Better error message user attempts upload directly file (#102, @tiernanmartin). crul v0.7.4 now minimum required version. waterbutler client now re-attempt failed requests 3 times. Consolidated internal client constructors. Increased wait time travis avoid time outs testing.

title: osfr 0.2.4
text: Listing files within specified path fail sibling directories shared common substring names (#95) Setting verbose=TRUE now works properly osf_upload() startup message printed OSF_SERVER defined Improved documentation n_max, GUIDs mysterious meta column

title: osfr 0.2.3
text: Failed OSF API requests now re-attempted 3 times (requires crul v0.7.0)

title: osfr 0.2.3
text: Fix incorrect column name empty osf_tbls (#88, @machow) longer importing modify_at() Add rOpenSci badge (#89, @maelle) Don’t build vignettes travis

title: osfr 0.2.2
text: Added osf_mv() move files directories new project, component, subdirectory osf_rm() can now delete files directories

title: osfr 0.2.2
text: Restructured tests better handle environments OSF_PAT /OSF_SERVER defined

title: osfr 0.2.1
text: Minor tweaks website osf_retrieve_file() longer retrieve files 3rd-party storage providers, since osfr functions currently support OSF storage

title: osfr 0.2.0
text: NOTE: version osfr rewrite original codebase. effectively entirely different package provides backwards compatibility functions versions < 0.2.0. last version previous package can installed remotes package: See https://docs.ropensci.org/osfr/ details new package.
code: remotes::install_github("ropensci/osfr@v0.1.1")
